scoring_rule: Each problem: ALL words must be correct. Level: 80% of problems must pass.

problems.prompt:
# Syllable Puzzle

Find 7 words using the syllables from the bank.
Each syllable is used exactly once (extras are distractors).

## Syllable Bank
veal, cream, ing, tort, tome, bermu, kirk, scal, smokey

## Clues
A. (1 syllables) — Of a boat: watertight.
B. (1 syllables) — a (usually) large and scholarly book
C. (1 syllables) — A state trooper. ''By extension'', a cop, police officer.
D. (1 syllables) — Frosting, custard, [masked]er or another substance similar to the oily part of milk or to whipped [masked].
E. (1 syllables) — a Scottish church
F. (2 syllables) — Structure hint: (suffix: -ing) — pattern, make, regulate, set, measure, or estimate according to some rate or standard
G. (1 syllables) — The female genitalia.

## Answer Format
Return JSON: {"answers": ["WORD1", "WORD2", ...]}
Words must be UPPERCASE and in clue order.

## Syllable Bank

## Clues

C. (2 syllables) — SYN: fall
D. (1 syllables) — SYN: can
E. (2 syllables) — SYN: re-start
F. (1 syllables) — SYN: AU
G. (3 syllables) — SYN: truly
H. (4 syllables) — of or relating to advancement

## Answer Format
Return JSON: {"answers": ["WORD1", "WORD2", ...]}
Words must be UPPERCASE and in clue order.

# Syllable Puzzle

Find 8 words using the syllables from the bank.
Each syllable is used exactly once (extras are distractors).

## Syllable Bank
her, co, gest, ceased, in, de, scores, blood, ed, is, min, ent, ter, tak, ers, texts, ad, bourne

## Clues
A. (4 syllables) — Relation hint: Category: direct — give or apply (medications)
B. (1 syllables) — Relation hint: Synonym: schoolbook — a passage from the Bible that is used as the subject of a sermon
C. (2 syllables) — Relation hint: Example usage: I wonder what the dead person would have done — Overwhelmed to the point of being figuratively dead.
D. (2 syllables) — Relation hint: Synonym: blood — bloody, bleeding.
E. (4 syllables) — Relation hint: Has prefix 'in-' — unable to express yourself clearly or fluently
F. (2 syllables) — Relation hint: Category: better — one who accepts an offer
G. (1 syllables) — Relation hint: Topic domain: noun.cognition — A stream or brook in which water flows only seasonally; a small stream or brook.
H. (1 syllables) — Relation hint: Related form: grade — induce to have sex

## Answer Format
Return JSON: {"answers": ["WORD1", "WORD2", ...]}
Words must be UPPERCASE and in clue order.

# Syllable Puzzle

Find 9 words using the syllables from the bank.
Each syllable is used exactly once (extras are distractors).

## Syllable Bank
ingston, lins, majesty, lo, tro, dork, out, dl, se, quence, habit, lines, jagged, pa, domes, elec, gob, oates

## Clues
A. (2 syllables) — a sketchy summary of the main points of an argument or theory
B. (2 syllables) — (folklore) a small grotesque supernatural creature that makes trouble for human beings
C. (1 syllables) — To act or behave in the manner of a dork.
D. (1 syllables) — United States writer (born in 1938)
E. (2 syllables) — To produce (music) with a sequencer.
F. (1 syllables) — put a [masked] on
G. (2 syllables) — Any of the traditional musical forms in flamenco.
H. (2 syllables) — An electronic style of hip hop; electrofunk.
I. (1 syllables) — a hemispherical roof

## Answer Format
Return JSON: {"answers": ["WORD1", "WORD2", ...]}
Words must be UPPERCASE and in clue order.
